thread.title: Celebrities at the Daytona 500 through the years | Newsday
thread.title_full: Celebrities at the Daytona 500 through the years | Newsday

author: Updated February
title: Celebrities at the Daytona 500 through the years | Newsday
text:
Click here to read or post comments (Credit: Getty Images / Jared C. Tilton) 
New England Patriots tight end Rob Gronkowski reacts before the 59th Annual DAYTONA 500 at Daytona International Speedway on Feb. 26, 2017 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Celebrities at the Daytona 500 through the years Updated February 26, 2017 5:22 PM 
Advertisement 
Celebrities are commonplace at the Oscars, Grammys and Emmys. But another event that stars gravitate to is NASCAR's Daytona 500. 
"The Great American Race" has attracted stars like Tom Cruise and John Travolta in the past. 
The 2016 edition is no different, with actor Gerard Butler serving as grand marshal and WWE Superstar John Cena serving as honorary pace car driver. (Credit: TNS / Stephen M. Dowell) 
Lady Antebellum singer Hillary Scott greets fans before the start of the Daytona 500 on Sunday, Feb. 26, 2017 at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla. (Credit: TNS / Stephen M. Dowell) 
NFL player Brandon Marshall greets fans before the start of the Daytona 500 on Sunday, Feb. 26, 2017 at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla. (Credit: TNS / Stephen M. Dowell) 
Lady Antebellum guitar player Dave Haywood signs autographs before the start of the Daytona 500 on Sunday, Feb. 26, 2017 at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla. 
ADVERTISEMENT ADVERTISE HERE (Credit: Getty Images / Sean Gardner) 
Actor Owen Wilson, grand marshal for the 59th Annual DAYTONA 500, reacts prior to the 59th Annual DAYTONA 500 at Daytona International Speedway on Feb. 26, 2017 in Daytona Beach, Florida. (Credit: TNS / Stephen M. Dowell) 
Orlando Magic center Nikola Vucevic poses with fans before the start of the Daytona 500 on Sunday, Feb. 26, 2017 at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla. (Credit: Getty Images North America / Sean Gardner) 
Rapper Waka Flocka Flame poses with New England Patriots tight end Rob Gronkowski before the 59th Annual DAYTONA 500 at Daytona International Speedway on Feb. 26, 2017 in Daytona Beach, Florida. (Credit: Getty Images for Disney / Gerardo Mora) 
Grand Marshal Owen Wilson, voice of Lightning McQueen in "Cars 3" poses with Lightning McQueen for the 59th Annual DAYTONA 500 at Daytona International Speedway on Feb. 26, 2017 in Daytona Beach, Florida. (Credit: AP / Phelan M. Ebenhack) 
Musical group Lady Antebellum perform before the NASCAR Daytona 500 auto race at Daytona International Speedway, Sunday, Feb. 26, 2017, in Daytona Beach, Fla. 
ADVERTISEMENT ADVERTISE HERE (Credit: AP / Terry Renna) 
New England Patriots' Rob Gronkowski gives a thumbs up during a news conference before the NASCAR Daytona 500 auto race at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., Sunday, Feb. 26, 2017. Gerard Butler (Credit: AP/ Terry Renna) 
Actor Gerard Butler poses with the Daytona 500 winner's trophy during a news conference before the NASCAR Daytona 500 Sprint Cup Series auto race at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., Sunday, Feb. 21, 2016. Butler is the grand marshal of the race. Florida Georgia Line (Credit: AP/ Terry Renna) 
Tyler Hubbard, right, and Brian Kelley, left, of Florida Georgia Line pose with International Speedway Corporation president Joie Chitwood III, center, during a news conference before the NASCAR Daytona 500 Sprint Cup Series auto race at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., Sunday, Feb. 21, 2016. Ndamukong Suh and Ken Griffey Jr. (Credit: Getty Images/ Sean Gardner) 
Ndamukong Suh, left, talks to Ken Griffey Jr during the drivers meeting prior to the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 21, 2016 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Wyclef Jean (Credit: Getty Images/ Sean Gardner) 
Wyclef Jean is seen at the driver's meeting prior to the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series DAYTONA 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 21, 2016 in Daytona Beach, Florida. (Photo by Sean Gardner/Getty Images) 
ADVERTISEMENT Ken Griffey Jr., John Cena and Gerard Butler (Credit: Getty Images/ Sean Gardner) 
Prior to the Daytona 500, from right, actor Gerard Butler, WWE Superstar John Cena and Major League Baseball Hall of Famer Ken Griffey Jr. take a selfie at the driver's meeting prior at Daytona International Speedway on February 21, 2016 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Cuba Gooding Jr. (Credit: Getty Images/ Sean Gardner) 
Actor Cuba Gooding Jr. is seen prior to the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series DAYTONA 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 21, 2016 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Charlotte McKinney (Credit: Getty Images/ Sean Gardner) 
Actress and model Charlotte McKinney is seen at the driver's meeting prior to the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series DAYTONA 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 21, 2016 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Angie Harmon and Jason Sehorn (Credit: Getty Images) 
Actress Angie Harmon, the official starter, and her husband, New York Giants veteran Jason Sehorn, at the Daytona 500 on Feb. 17, 2002. Mariah Carey (Credit: Getty Images) 
Mariah Carey sings the national anthem during the NASCAR Winston Cup Daytona 500 on February 16, 2003 at the Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Florida. John Travolta and Kelly Preston (Credit: Getty Images) 
Actor John Travolta with his wife Kelly Preston attend the NASCAR Winston Cup Daytona 500 at the Daytona International Speedway on February 16, 2003 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Ludacris (Credit: Getty Images) 
Rapper Ludacris watches the race from Dale Earnhardt Jr.'s pit box during the NASCAR Daytona 500 at the Daytona International Speedway on February 16, 2003 in Daytona, Florida. Ben Affleck (Credit: Getty Images) 
Actors Ben Affleck and Whoopi Goldberg applaud during driver introductions prior to the Daytona 500 on February 15, 2004 at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Florida. LeAnn Rimes (Credit: Getty Images) 
LeAnn Rimes sings during the pre-race show for the NASCAR Nextel Cup Daytona 500 on February 15, 2004 at the Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Florida. Vanessa Williams (Credit: AP) 
Singer and actress Vanessa Williams is surrounded by soldiers trying to take her photo after she sang the national anthem prior to the start of the Daytona 500 at the Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., on Sunday, Feb. 20, 2005. Matthew McConaughey (Credit: ASSOCIATED PRESS / GLENN SMITH) 
NASCAR driver Mike Wallace, center, poses with celebrities prior to the start of the Daytona 500 at the Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., on Feb. 20, 2005. Posing with Wallace are, from left, honorary starter Ashton Kutcher, grand marshal Matthew McConaughey, then-Boston Red Sox center fielder Johnny Damon and United States Army veteran Jessica Lynch. Ashton Kutcher (Credit: Getty Images) 
Actor Ashton Kutcher waves the green flag for the start of the Daytona 500 on February 20, 2005 at the Daytona International Speedway in Daytona, Florida. Clint Black (Credit: AP) 
Grammy Award-winning country music singer Clint Black performs prior to the start of the Daytona 500 at the Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., on Feb. 20, 2005. Jon Bon Jovi and Sugarland's Jennifer Nettles (Credit: Getty Images) 
Jon Bon Jovi performs with Jennifer Nettles of the country duo Sugarland prior to the Daytona 500 on February 19, 2006 at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Florida. Roger Clemens and Jay Leno (Credit: AP) 
Seven-time Cy Young Award winner Roger Clemens, left, talks with NASCAR Daytona 500 honorary starter James Caan, right, and Jay Leno prior to the start of the Daytona 500 auto race at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., on Feb. 19, 2006. Kelly Clarkson (Credit: Getty Images) 
Singer Kelly Clarkson performs during the Nextel Tribute to America, prior to the Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 18, 2007 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Nicolas Cage and Cal Ripken Jr. (Credit: AP) 
Actor and Daytona 500 Grand Marshal Nicolas Cage, left, talks with baseball great and Daytona 500 Pace Car driver Cal Ripken Jr. prior to the start of the Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway, Sunday, February 18, 2007 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Big and Rich (Credit: AP) 
Country singers Big Kenny, left, and John Rich of Big and Rich sing the national anthem prior to the start of the Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., on Feb. 18, 2007. Eli Manning (Credit: Getty Images) 
Eli Manning, quarterback for the New York Giants, attends the NASCAR Nextel Cup Series Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 18, 2007 in Daytona, Florida. Trisha Yearwood (Credit: AP) 
Trisha Yearwood sings the national anthem prior to the start of the Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., on Feb. 17, 2008. Ashley Judd (Credit: AP) 
Ashley Judd walks through the garage area of the Daytona International Speedway on Sunday, Feb. 10, 2008 after then-husband Dario Franchitti husband drove his qualifying laps for the Daytona 500. Brooks and Dunn (Credit: Getty Images) 
Country music duo Brooks and Dunn performs prior to the start of the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 17, 2008 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Keith Urban (Credit: Getty Images) 
Singer Keith Urban sings during pre-race activities for the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 15, 2009 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Tom Cruise (Credit: AP) 
Actor Tom Cruise waves to fans during pre-race activities before the NASCAR Daytona 500 auto race at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., Sunday, Feb. 15, 2009. Gavin Degraw (Credit: Getty Images) 
Singer Gavin Degraw sits on the No. 83 Red Bull Toyota pit box during the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 15, 2009 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Brock Lesnar and Sable (Credit: Getty Images) 
WWE world heavyweight champion and former UFC heavyweight champion Brock Lesnar, center, speaks with Kevin Harvick, while Lesnar's wife, former WWE Diva Sable, looks on during practice for the Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 13, 2010 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Tim McGraw (Credit: AP) 
Country music singer Tim McGraw performs prior to the start of the Daytona 500 NASCAR race at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., on Feb. 14, 2010. Harry Connick Jr. (Credit: AP) 
Singer Harry Connick Jr. performs the national anthem prior to the start of the Daytona 500 NASCAR race at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., on Feb. 14, 2010. Josh Duhamel and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley (Credit: Getty Images) 
Actor Josh Duhamel, left, and actress Rosie Huntington-Whiteley talk with NASCAR driver Juan Pablo Montoya before the start of the Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 20, 2011 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Brad Paisley (Credit: AP) 
Country music singer Brad Paisley performs prior to the start of the Daytona 500 NASCAR auto race at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., Sunday, Feb. 20, 2011. Dierks Bentley (Credit: Getty Images) 
Country singer Dierks Bentley performs prior to the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 20, 2011 in Daytona Beach, Florida. John Cena, Mitt Romney and NY Giants (Credit: AP) 
Then-Republican presidential candidate, former Massachusetts Gov. Mitt Romney, second from left, poses with WWE star John Cena, second from right, and then- New York Giants NFL football players Osi Umenyiora, left, and Justin Tuck, right, before the NASCAR Daytona 500 Sprint Cup series auto race at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., on Feb. 26, 2012. Kate Upton, Jane Lynch and The Three Stooges (Credit: Getty Images) 
From left, actors Kate Upton, Chris Diamantopoulos as Moe, Sean Hayes as Larry and Will Sasso as Curly, and Jane Lynch pose during an appearance prior to the start of the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 26, 2012. Lenny Kravitz (Credit: AP) 
Lenny Kravitz performs before the NASCAR Daytona 500 auto race at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., on Feb. 26, 2012. Willie and Korie Robertson of 'Duck Dynasty' (Credit: AP) 
Willie Robertson, left, and Korie Robertson, of the reality TV show "Duck Dynasty," before the Daytona 500 NASCAR race on Feb. 24, 2013, at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla. Zac Brown Band (Credit: Getty Images) 
Singer/musician Zac Brown of the Zac Brown Band performs prior to the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 24, 2013 in Daytona Beach, Florida. James Franco (Credit: AP) 
Actor James Franco, the 2013 Daytona 500 honorary starter, poses the near the winner's trophy before the start of the race on Sunday, Feb. 24, 2013, at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla. Ray Lewis (Credit: AP) 
Former Baltimore Ravens linebacker Ray Lewis waves the green flag to start the Daytona 500 NASCAR Sprint Cup Series race on Feb. 24, 2013, at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla. Aloe Blacc (Credit: AP) 
Entertainer Aloe Blacc answers a question during a news conference before the NASCAR Daytona 500 auto race at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., on Feb. 23, 2014. Gary Sinise (Credit: AP) 
Actor Gary Sinise poses with the winner's trophy for the NASCAR Daytona 500 Sprint Cup series auto race at Daytona International Speedway during a news conference in Daytona Beach, Fla., Sunday, Feb. 23, 2014. Luke Bryan (Credit: AP) 
Singer Luke Bryan performs before the NASCAR Daytona 500 Sprint Cup series auto race at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., on Feb. 23, 2014. Larry the Cable Guy (Credit: AP) 
Larry the Cable Guy has fun with race fan while playing a tire toss game at the Prilosec OTC ZERO Experience at the Daytona 500, Feb. 23, 2014 in Daytona Beach, Fla. 50 Cent (Credit: Getty Images) 
Michael Waltrip, driver of the #66 BlueDEF/AAA Toyota, stands with Curtis '50 Cent' Jackson and Miss Sprints Kim Coon and Brooke Werner during the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 23, 2014 in Daytona Beach, Florida. (Credit: AP) 
Kid Rock performs before the Daytona 500 NASCAR Sprint Cup series auto race at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., Sunday, Feb. 22, 2015. Vince Vaughn (Credit: Getty Images) 
Brad Keselowski, driver of the No. 2 Miller Lite Ford, speaks with actor Vince Vaughn in the driver meeting prior to the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series 57th Annual Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 22, 2015 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Funkmaster Flex (Credit: Getty Images) 
Recording artist Funkmaster Flex stands by the No. 44 Golden Coral Chevrolet, driven by Reed Sorenson, on the grid prior to the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series 57th Annual Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 22, 2015 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Amy Purdy (Credit: AP) 
Actress, model, world-class snowboarder and 2014 Paralympic bronze medalist Amy Purdy answers questions at a news conference before the Daytona 500 NASCAR Sprint Cup series auto race at Daytona International Speedway, Sunday, Feb. 22, 2015, in Daytona Beach, Fla. Purdy drove the pace car for the race. Abby Wambach, Christie Rampone and Kelley O'Hara (Credit: Getty Images) 
From left, United States women's national soccer team members Abby Wambach, Christie Rampone and Kelley O'Hara attend the driver meeting during the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series 57th Annual Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 22, 2015 in Daytona Beach, Florida. Phillip Phillips (Credit: AP) 
Singer Phillip Phillips answers questions from the media during a news conference before the Daytona 500 NASCAR Sprint Cup series auto race at Daytona International Speedway in Daytona Beach, Fla., Sunday, Feb. 22, 2015. Phillips performed the national anthem before the race. Enter your email address to subscribe to Newsday's Sports Now newsletter
